title: theBalancedBriefNLtech
description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from theBalancedBriefNLtech, skipping any feeds with errors.

items.title: How to Set Up Your New Android Phone (2025)
items.description: Welcome to your shiny new Google-powered mobile device. It will be up and ready in no time with these handy tips.

items.title: Best Handheld Fan and Wearable Fan (2025), Tested and Reviewed
items.description: Whether you’re at a festival, tennis match, or wedding, these hand fans and wearable cooling devices will make the heat way more bearable.

items.title: The 71 Best Deals From REI’s 2025 Labor Day Sale
items.description: Shop the best deals on WIRED-tested outdoor gear from REI, Nemo, MSR, Coleman, Fjällräven, and more during REI’s Labor Day sale.

items.title: Key Pixel Settings to Change on Your Google Phone
items.description: Some of the best reasons to use a Pixel phone are turned off by default. Follow these steps to get the most out of your device.

items.title: How to Clean a TV Screen or Computer Monitor
items.description: Put away those caustic wipes! Here’s how to clean your computer monitor.

items.title: Taco Bell is having second thoughts about relying on AI at the drive-through
items.description: Taco Bell has apparently rolled out voice AI-powered ordering at more than 500 drive-throughs, leading to unflattering viral moments like someone orde...

items.title: The fall of EV startup Fisker: A comprehensive timeline
items.description: Here is a timeline of the events that led fledgling automaker Fisker to file for bankruptcy.

items.title: Cracks are forming in Meta’s partnership with Scale AI
items.description: Two months after making a $14.3B investment in Scale AI, Meta is relying heavily on its competitors to train next generation AI models.

items.title: Nvidia says two mystery customers accounted for 39% of Q2 revenue
items.description: Nearly 40% of Nvidia’s second quarter revenue came from just two companies, identified in a filing as "Customer A" and "Customer B."

items.title: I’m really impressed with this $400 portable projector
items.description: Projectors have come a long way and this portable one from Lumi offers impressive features, like Google TV and an obstacle avoidance function.
